intro: Antirhea maestrensis, commonly known as the Maestrense Antirhea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and orange. Its leaves are usually elliptical and arranged oppositely along the stems. Antirhea maestrensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
